definitions.definition: A terrifying and dangerous creature , especially one of an imaginary or mythical kind.

examples: The children decided Grover was a cuddly monster .

definitions.definition: A cruel , heartless , or antisocial person, especially a criminal .
examples: Get away from those children, you monster !

definitions.definition: A deformed animal or person (especially, a severely deformed one); in previous centuries often taken as an ill omen at the time of its birth. ( Offensive when applied to humans in modern usage.)
examples: The villagers were worried because the weather had been strange and several monsters had been born among the flocks and people.

definitions.definition: A badly behaved person , especially a child ; a brat .

examples: Have you seen those powerlifters on TV? They're monsters .

definitions.definition: A prodigy ; someone very talented in a specific domain.
examples: That dude playing guitar is a monster .

definitions.definition: A non-player character that player(s) fight against in role-playing games; a mob

main_definition: A terrifying and dangerous creature , especially one of an imaginary or mythical kind.
secondary_definitions: A cruel , heartless , or antisocial person, especially a criminal .

( archaic ) A deformed animal or person (especially, a severely deformed one); in previous centuries often taken as an ill omen at the time of its birth. ( Offensive when applied to humans in modern usage.)
( figuratively , humorous ) A badly behaved person , especially a child ; a brat .
( informal ) Something very or unusually large .
( informal ) A prodigy ; someone very talented in a specific domain.
( gaming ) A non-player character that player(s) fight against in role-playing games; a mob
